intro: Streptoura caudivolvula, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, erect growth habit and features basal leaves that are narrow and linear. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
